DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the volume in microliters (ml) of the aliquot derived from the analyte.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._A unit of volume equal to one thousandth (10E-3) of a liter._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.:A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed with a max of 6 characters and 2 decimals, units of measure not specified.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
